{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Client Relationship Manager",
  "description": "IT Horizons is a&nbsp;provider of network and security solutions. It offers digital network architecture, fiber optics, unified communications, cloud, mobile security, storage, etc. The company caters to finance, healthcare, education, government, logistics, and other sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Client Relationship Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The position is responsible for developing, maintaining and managing sales activities of the business within Abujaenvirons, as well as developing and implementing an innovative, growth-focused commercial strategy, focused primarily on new opportunities and markets.
	The Client Relationship Manager shall be responsible for driving the acquisition of the Company&rsquo;s customers, its revenue goals and the general direction and management of all sales and marketing activities, including market, competitiveness, product definition/pricing and distribution/diversity strategies.
	Directing strategy towards the profitable growth and operation of the company.
	Represents the company externally to enhance and strengthen the company&rsquo;s profile and optimizes all business development opportunities.
	Maintains a good level of understanding and knowledge of the Company&rsquo;s products and services, ensuring that customer queries can be captured and dealt with accurately and appropriately
	Ensures that all commercial activities meet or improve on budget, cost, volume and efficiency targets (Key Performance Indicators (Key Performance Indicators)) in line with business objectives.
	Achieve growth and hit sales targets by successfully meeting set targets
	Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with them and understanding their needs
	Work with the Head of Sales &amp; Marketing to ensure consistent lead generation.
	Support the Head of Sales &amp; Marketing in preparing and implementing annual work and resource plans; support their applicability within the overall company strategy.
	Identifies business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position


in the industry; researching and analyzing sales options:


	Maintains relationships with clients by providing support, information, and guidance; researching and recommending new opportunities; recommending profit and service improvements
	Making accurate cost calculations to provide customers with quotations
	Achieve growth and hit sales targets of the organization through effective planning and budgeting.
	Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands company&rsquo;s customer base and ensure its strong presence
	Present sales, revenue and expenses reports and realistic forecasts to your line manager
	Collaborate with Technical team on sales technology initiatives
	Ensure correct usage of CRM and other sales applications
	Train and ensure adherence to sales process
	Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
	Ensure that all sales representative activities are in accordance with the guidelines of the Company&rsquo;s Code of Conduct.
	Accomplishes marketing and organization mission by completing related results as needed.
	Protects organization&#39;s value by keeping information confidential.
	Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
	Liaise with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution
	Develops qualified leads and generate new business in line with the Company&rsquo;s commercial target
	Builds effective relationships with potential clients and existing customers
	Speaks positively and enthusiastically about the Company and its products and services to ensure that a professional company and brand image is provided at all times to customers and colleagues
	Acts as spokesperson for the company at industry events
	Perform other duties that may be assigned by the Head of Sales.


Requirements


	University Degree in a relevant discipline
	Minimum of 4 years of work experience in ICT/Telecoms or related industry,
	Master&rsquo;s degree from a recognized University will be an advantage.
	Membership of professional management associations will be an added advantage


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application and detailed CV to:&nbsp;careers@ithorizonsgroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-11-26",

Client Relationship Manager Job at IT Horizons Limited




        
    

        
        IT Horizons is a provider of network and security solutions. It offers digital network architecture, fiber optics, unified communications, cloud, mobile security, storage, etc. The company caters to finance, healthcare, education, government, logistics, and other sectors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Client Relationship Manager

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The position is responsible for developing, maintaining and managing sales activities of the business within Abujaenvirons, as well as developing and implementing an innovative, growth-focused commercial strategy, focused primarily on new opportunities and markets.
	The Client Relationship Manager shall be responsible for driving the acquisition of the Company’s customers, its revenue goals and the general direction and management of all sales and marketing activities, including market, competitiveness, product definition/pricing and distribution/diversity strategies.
	Directing strategy towards the profitable growth and operation of the company.
	Represents the company externally to enhance and strengthen the company’s profile and optimizes all business development opportunities.
	Maintains a good level of understanding and knowledge of the Company’s products and services, ensuring that customer queries can be captured and dealt with accurately and appropriately
	Ensures that all commercial activities meet or improve on budget, cost, volume and efficiency targets (Key Performance Indicators (Key Performance Indicators)) in line with business objectives.
	Achieve growth and hit sales targets by successfully meeting set targets
	Build and promote strong, long-lasting customer relationships by partnering with them and understanding their needs
	Work with the Head of Sales & Marketing to ensure consistent lead generation.
	Support the Head of Sales & Marketing in preparing and implementing annual work and resource plans; support their applicability within the overall company strategy.
	Identifies business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating their position


in the industry; researching and analyzing sales options:


	Maintains relationships with clients by providing support, information, and guidance; researching and recommending new opportunities; recommending profit and service improvements
	Making accurate cost calculations to provide customers with quotations
	Achieve growth and hit sales targets of the organization through effective planning and budgeting.
	Design and implement a strategic business plan that expands company’s customer base and ensure its strong presence
	Present sales, revenue and expenses reports and realistic forecasts to your line manager
	Collaborate with Technical team on sales technology initiatives
	Ensure correct usage of CRM and other sales applications
	Train and ensure adherence to sales process
	Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed
	Ensure that all sales representative activities are in accordance with the guidelines of the Company’s Code of Conduct.
	Accomplishes marketing and organization mission by completing related results as needed.
	Protects organization's value by keeping information confidential.
	Updates job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.
	Liaise with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution
	Develops qualified leads and generate new business in line with the Company’s commercial target
	Builds effective relationships with potential clients and existing customers
	Speaks positively and enthusiastically about the Company and its products and services to ensure that a professional company and brand image is provided at all times to customers and colleagues
	Acts as spokesperson for the company at industry events
	Perform other duties that may be assigned by the Head of Sales.


Requirements


	University Degree in a relevant discipline
	Minimum of 4 years of work experience in ICT/Telecoms or related industry,
	Master’s degree from a recognized University will be an advantage.
	Membership of professional management associations will be an added advantage


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Application and detailed CV to: careers@ithorizonsgroup.com using the Job Posiiton as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Data Analyst Lead - Finance",
  "description": "Kuda is a full service, app-based digital bank. Our mission is to be the go-to bank not just for those living on the African continent, but also for the African diaspora wherever they might live, anywhere in the world. Kuda is free of ridiculous banking charges and great at helping customers budget, spend smartly and save more. We raised the largest seed round ever seen in Africa, and completed a Series A funding round in February 2021, led by some of the world&#39;s smartest venture capital investors. With offices in London (our HQ), Lagos and Cape Town, and further offices opening across Africa during 2021, Kuda is fast becoming recognised as the leading &#39;Neobank&#39; for Africans.

To help us grow into the company that can bring meaningful change to the way people across Africa get access to great financial products and services in order to take control of their personal finances, we are actively looking for bright, talented, driven people who are excited by our mission. If this sounds like a great way to spend your valuable time, then please get in touch with us.

We are&nbsp;recruiting to fill the position below

Job Position:&nbsp;Data Analyst Lead - Finance

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	This is a critical, high-impact role within the Group Finance department.
	You will be the go-to person for all matters related to transactional data, working across all business departments to develop a deep understanding of our data structure.
	The core focus of this role is to ensure Group Finance has access to up-to-date, accurate dashboards and KPIs.
	You will be responsible for maintaining our central KPI database, reviewing definitions, and driving the business towards a single source of truth for all financial and operational metrics.
	You will also support the team with ad-hoc business intelligence analytics to drive strategic decisions.


Responsibilities
Data Quality &amp; Integrity:


	Perform end-to-end reconciliation of transactional data across all key systems (e.g., core banking platform [Nerve], ERP [D365/Xero], and management accounts) to ensure 100% data completeness and accuracy.
	Validate that product transaction flows and volumes match financial records.
	Support the migration of transactional data from our legacy systems onto ERP and legacy accounting systems.
	Provide critical support to the Finance team during audits, conducting ad-hoc analysis on revenue recognition, historical manual adjustments, and other data requests.
	Drive data consistency by identifying, explaining, and eliminating manual adjustments, ensuring all processes are automated and auditable.
	Govern our BI environment by decommissioning unused reports (e.g., in Looker) to establish and maintain a single source of truth for all reporting.


KPI Database &amp; Dashboard Management:


	Own, maintain, and enhance the central Finance KPI database, establishing it as the single source of truth for Finance, Growth, Product, and other departments.
	Consolidate existing reports (e.g., Ops Report, Performance Report) into the central KPI database to streamline reporting.
	Prepare and automate dynamic dashboards for the visual representation of Management Accounts.
	Develop and maintain a comprehensive data dictionary, documenting all KPI definitions and making them accessible to the entire organization.
	Automate month-end and month-to-date (MTD) KPI updates for all key metrics.
	Collaborate with finance leadership to design and build MTD Budget vs. Actuals dashboards for periodic, real-time reporting to the Executive Committee (ExCo).


Ad-Hoc BI Analysis:


	Serve as the primary point of contact for ad-hoc analysis and data requests from Finance and other departments, investigating trends and answering key business questions.
	Work collaboratively with Finance, Growth, and Product teams to investigate and report on trends in key financial metrics.
	Support the Growth team by providing finance-related data points required to develop an accurate marketing attribution model.
	Analyze and present financial metrics in response to queries from town halls or other leadership forums.


Business Development &amp; Finance Operations Support:


	Partner with the Finance and Product teams to ensure any new revenue stream or product is correctly integrated from a transactional data perspective and can be accurately reported in legacy accounting systems and ERP.
	Play a key role in the month-end closing process, ensuring all transaction-level revenue and metrics are accurate and reconciled.
	Help define, build, and visualize the company&#39;s revenue model within our BI tools.
	Contribute to business development and expansion-related calls as the data expert, when required.


Requirements


	Bachelor&#39;s degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.
	5+ years of experience in a Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Financial Analysis role.
	Experience in fintech, banking, or a high-growth digital/tech company is strongly preferred.
	Expert-level SQL skills&nbsp;for data extraction, manipulation, and complex analysis are essential.
	Advanced proficiency in BI and visualization tools&nbsp;(e.g., Looker, Power BI, Tableau) with a proven track record of building impactful dashboards.
	Strong understanding of financial principles, accounting, revenue recognition, FX, and management accounts.
	Experience with ERP systems (e.g., NetSuite, Xero) and data warehouses/cubes.
	Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail.
	A proactive, self-starting attitude with the ability to take initiative and manage multiple projects independently.
	Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-25",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-26",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Kuda Bank"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {
    "@type": "PropertyValue",
    "name": "",
    "value": "189397"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Data Analyst Lead - Finance Job at Kuda Bank




        
    

        
        Kuda is a full service, app-based digital bank. Our mission is to be the go-to bank not just for those living on the African continent, but also for the African diaspora wherever they might live, anywhere in the world. Kuda is free of ridiculous banking charges and great at helping customers budget, spend smartly and save more. We raised the largest seed round ever seen in Africa, and completed a Series A funding round in February 2021, led by some of the world's smartest venture capital investors. With offices in London (our HQ), Lagos and Cape Town, and further offices opening across Africa during 2021, Kuda is fast becoming recognised as the leading 'Neobank' for Africans.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



To help us grow into the company that can bring meaningful change to the way people across Africa get access to great financial products and services in order to take control of their personal finances, we are actively looking for bright, talented, driven people who are excited by our mission. If this sounds like a great way to spend your valuable time, then please get in touch with us.

We are recruiting to fill the position below

Job Position: Data Analyst Lead - Finance

Job Location: Lagos
Job Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	This is a critical, high-impact role within the Group Finance department.
	You will be the go-to person for all matters related to transactional data, working across all business departments to develop a deep understanding of our data structure.
	The core focus of this role is to ensure Group Finance has access to up-to-date, accurate dashboards and KPIs.
	You will be responsible for maintaining our central KPI database, reviewing definitions, and driving the business towards a single source of truth for all financial and operational metrics.
	You will also support the team with ad-hoc business intelligence analytics to drive strategic decisions.


Responsibilities
Data Quality & Integrity:


	Perform end-to-end reconciliation of transactional data across all key systems (e.g., core banking platform [Nerve], ERP [D365/Xero], and management accounts) to ensure 100% data completeness and accuracy.
	Validate that product transaction flows and volumes match financial records.
	Support the migration of transactional data from our legacy systems onto ERP and legacy accounting systems.
	Provide critical support to the Finance team during audits, conducting ad-hoc analysis on revenue recognition, historical manual adjustments, and other data requests.
	Drive data consistency by identifying, explaining, and eliminating manual adjustments, ensuring all processes are automated and auditable.
	Govern our BI environment by decommissioning unused reports (e.g., in Looker) to establish and maintain a single source of truth for all reporting.


KPI Database & Dashboard Management:


	Own, maintain, and enhance the central Finance KPI database, establishing it as the single source of truth for Finance, Growth, Product, and other departments.
	Consolidate existing reports (e.g., Ops Report, Performance Report) into the central KPI database to streamline reporting.
	Prepare and automate dynamic dashboards for the visual representation of Management Accounts.
	Develop and maintain a comprehensive data dictionary, documenting all KPI definitions and making them accessible to the entire organization.
	Automate month-end and month-to-date (MTD) KPI updates for all key metrics.
	Collaborate with finance leadership to design and build MTD Budget vs. Actuals dashboards for periodic, real-time reporting to the Executive Committee (ExCo).


Ad-Hoc BI Analysis:


	Serve as the primary point of contact for ad-hoc analysis and data requests from Finance and other departments, investigating trends and answering key business questions.
	Work collaboratively with Finance, Growth, and Product teams to investigate and report on trends in key financial metrics.
	Support the Growth team by providing finance-related data points required to develop an accurate marketing attribution model.
	Analyze and present financial metrics in response to queries from town halls or other leadership forums.


Business Development & Finance Operations Support:


	Partner with the Finance and Product teams to ensure any new revenue stream or product is correctly integrated from a transactional data perspective and can be accurately reported in legacy accounting systems and ERP.
	Play a key role in the month-end closing process, ensuring all transaction-level revenue and metrics are accurate and reconciled.
	Help define, build, and visualize the company's revenue model within our BI tools.
	Contribute to business development and expansion-related calls as the data expert, when required.


Requirements


	Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related quantitative field.
	5+ years of experience in a Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Financial Analysis role.
	Experience in fintech, banking, or a high-growth digital/tech company is strongly preferred.
	Expert-level SQL skills for data extraction, manipulation, and complex analysis are essential.
	Advanced proficiency in BI and visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Power BI, Tableau) with a proven track record of building impactful dashboards.
	Strong understanding of financial principles, accounting, revenue recognition, FX, and management accounts.
	Experience with ERP systems (e.g., NetSuite, Xero) and data warehouses/cubes.
	Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills with meticulous attention to detail.
	A proactive, self-starting attitude with the ability to take initiative and manage multiple projects independently.
	Excellent communication skills, with the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Java Backend Developer",
  "description": "Renmoney - We are a passionate team determined to challenge the status quo and make financial inclusion count for the millions of under-banked individuals and small business owners in Nigeria. We provide loans, savings, and fixed deposit solutions to our customers. Our vision is to be the most convenient lending company, delivering outstanding service experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Java Backend Developer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)

We Are the Place for You If


	You&rsquo;re passionate about backend engineering and love building high-performance systems that scale.
	You take pride in writing clean, reliable code and thrive in a culture that values both speed and quality.
	You enjoy solving complex technical challenges and working with teams that care about doing things the right way.





The Position


	We&rsquo;re hiring strong backend engineers to join our core engineering teams across Banking, Loans, Core Tech Platform, and Cards.
	You will be part of a team responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining backend systems that power our key financial products and platforms.


What you&rsquo;ll do


	Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services for core financial products.
	Write production-grade code with a focus on reliability, maintainability, and testability.
	Work with distributed systems and ensure observability and performance across environments.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver backend solutions that align with business and product goals.
	Contribute to architectural decisions and ensure adherence to engineering best practices.


Requirements
What you&rsquo;ll do:


	Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services for core financial products.
	Write production-grade code with a focus on reliability, maintainability, and testability.
	Work with distributed systems and ensure observability and performance across environments.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver backend solutions that align with business and product goals.
	Contribute to architectural decisions and ensure adherence to engineering best practices.


What&rsquo;s in It for You


	The opportunity to work in an innovative fintech company with a global reach.
	Engaging projects where you can directly influence the development of cutting-edge products.
	The chance to grow your skills and collaborate with talented engineers in a global, distributed team environment.
	A culture that celebrates clarity, innovation, and technical excellence.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-25",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-26",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Renmoney"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",
      "addressLocality": "Lagos",
      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,

    }

}



Java Backend Developer Job at Renmoney




        
    

        
        Renmoney - We are a passionate team determined to challenge the status quo and make financial inclusion count for the millions of under-banked individuals and small business owners in Nigeria. We provide loans, savings, and fixed deposit solutions to our customers. Our vision is to be the most convenient lending company, delivering outstanding service experiences.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Java Backend Developer

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)

We Are the Place for You If
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	You’re passionate about backend engineering and love building high-performance systems that scale.
	You take pride in writing clean, reliable code and thrive in a culture that values both speed and quality.
	You enjoy solving complex technical challenges and working with teams that care about doing things the right way.





The Position


	We’re hiring strong backend engineers to join our core engineering teams across Banking, Loans, Core Tech Platform, and Cards.
	You will be part of a team responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining backend systems that power our key financial products and platforms.


What you’ll do


	Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services for core financial products.
	Write production-grade code with a focus on reliability, maintainability, and testability.
	Work with distributed systems and ensure observability and performance across environments.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver backend solutions that align with business and product goals.
	Contribute to architectural decisions and ensure adherence to engineering best practices.


Requirements
What you’ll do:


	Design, build, and maintain scalable backend services for core financial products.
	Write production-grade code with a focus on reliability, maintainability, and testability.
	Work with distributed systems and ensure observability and performance across environments.
	Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver backend solutions that align with business and product goals.
	Contribute to architectural decisions and ensure adherence to engineering best practices.


What’s in It for You


	The opportunity to work in an innovative fintech company with a global reach.
	Engaging projects where you can directly influence the development of cutting-edge products.
	The chance to grow your skills and collaborate with talented engineers in a global, distributed team environment.
	A culture that celebrates clarity, innovation, and technical excellence.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "QAQC Backend Officer",
  "description": "ETC Workforce Services Limited -&nbsp;We are a leading&nbsp;workforce management, outsourcing and advisory organization, empowering businesses to focus on their core competencies while we handle the complexities of HR, staffing, and operational support.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: QAQC Backend Officer
Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Reporting To: QAQC Backend Validation Specialist

Role Purpose


	We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical QAQC Backend Officer to support post-metering issue resolution and quality assurance across Business Units.
	This role ensures compliance with metering standards, coordinates backend validations, and contributes to continuous improvement in metering operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure quality standards are met across all metering initiatives, both personally and within the back-office team.
	Perform daily validation and evaluation of surveys and installations.
	Check for consistency in survey and installation reports.
	Ensure closure of non-conformance issues raised by subcontractors or NMD representatives.
	Generate and analyse weekly performance and metering quality reports.
	Escalate unresolved issues to relevant teams including BU Vigilance and QAQC Surveillance.
	Monitor field operations for compliance with established policies.
	Submit weekly evaluation reports to the QAQC Field Unit, including lists of installations for surveillance.
	Update resolution feedback from cross-functional units.
	Support departmental objectives through assigned tasks.
	Comply with Quality Management System and Occupational Health &amp; Safety regulations.


Minimum Requirements


	First degree in Social Sciences or Engineering.
	0&ndash;3 years of post-qualification experience.


Skills &amp; Competencies
Technical Competencies:


	Relationship management and interpersonal skills
	Data reconciliation and review
	Fair knowledge of metering systems
	Understanding of industry regulations and electricity standards
	Planning and organizing


Behavioural Competencies:


	Commitment to task and independent decision-making
	Ability to multitask and perform under pressure
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-10-25",
  "validThrough": "2025-11-26",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "ETC Workforce Services Limited"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    }
  }
}



QAQC Backend Officer Job at ETC Workforce Services Limited




        
    

        
        ETC Workforce Services Limited - We are a leading workforce management, outsourcing and advisory organization, empowering businesses to focus on their core competencies while we handle the complexities of HR, staffing, and operational support.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: QAQC Backend Officer
Job Location: Lagos, Nigeria
Reporting To: QAQC Backend Validation Specialist

Role Purpose
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical QAQC Backend Officer to support post-metering issue resolution and quality assurance across Business Units.
	This role ensures compliance with metering standards, coordinates backend validations, and contributes to continuous improvement in metering operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Ensure quality standards are met across all metering initiatives, both personally and within the back-office team.
	Perform daily validation and evaluation of surveys and installations.
	Check for consistency in survey and installation reports.
	Ensure closure of non-conformance issues raised by subcontractors or NMD representatives.
	Generate and analyse weekly performance and metering quality reports.
	Escalate unresolved issues to relevant teams including BU Vigilance and QAQC Surveillance.
	Monitor field operations for compliance with established policies.
	Submit weekly evaluation reports to the QAQC Field Unit, including lists of installations for surveillance.
	Update resolution feedback from cross-functional units.
	Support departmental objectives through assigned tasks.
	Comply with Quality Management System and Occupational Health & Safety regulations.


Minimum Requirements


	First degree in Social Sciences or Engineering.
	0–3 years of post-qualification experience.


Skills & Competencies
Technical Competencies:


	Relationship management and interpersonal skills
	Data reconciliation and review
	Fair knowledge of metering systems
	Understanding of industry regulations and electricity standards
	Planning and organizing


Behavioural Competencies:


	Commitment to task and independent decision-making
	Ability to multitask and perform under pressure
	Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
    

    

        Click here to Apply  
        

    
     




        
        

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});

Administrative Officer Job at TAIDOB College




        
    

        
        TAIDOB College is a government-approved private secondary school strategically located within Goshen Estate, Asero, Abeokuta, Ogun State. Dr. Abayomi Oluwatosin Jiboku, a seasoned educationist cum administrator established the college in October 1994 as a model with the motive of providing educational services to all races irrespective of gender, religion, tribe or social status. This unique citadel of learning is situated in a quiet, serene and conducive environment, equipped with modern educational infrastructural facilities and of dedicated and experienced tutors.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Location: Abeokuta, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Ensure smooth day-to-day running of the office operations
	Prepare, update, and manage official records and correspondence
	Ensure submission of reports and documentation
	Schedule and coordinate meetings, appointments, and evets.
	Assist with staff attendance records
	Maintain updated staff & student files.


Requirements


	Must possess at least a B.Sc., B.Ed., or HND, in Business Administration, Mass Communication, Marketing or other related fields from reputable institutions.
	Must possess at least 2 years of cognate experience working as an administrator/ marketer.
	Meticulous attention to detail with superb organizational skills.
	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a team.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: tcrecruitment10@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply
